channel.title: Fatal: Buffer overflow
channel.description: What does that mean? That the server is full? because my servers ram is at 0% - 8% and it wont let any more people on. And max users is set to 1000.

item.title: Fatal: Buffer overflow
item.dc:creator: @zoltanman zoltanman
item.description:
@zoltanman wrote:

[quote=“Unid H4x0r, post:10, topic:136633”][quote author=bjc22 link=topic=188167.msg1699020#msg1699020 date=1188005237]
Well buffer overflow doesnt crash the server, It just stops people from logging in until there are less than like 58 people on. But my max users is set to 1000 and my cpu ussage is only 8%. So I dont understand why its doing that :
[/quote] lol[/quote]

Just stop trying to help people, you fail. Fatal Buffer overflow means somebody is massing something on your server, usually it’s a flaw in somebodys code. Just look through any objects and add a timer to it.

Read full topic

item.title: Fatal: Buffer overflow
item.dc:creator: @zonus_warrior zonus warrior
item.description:
@zonus_warrior wrote:

the only time i get that error is when people mass on some object so i put a timer on everything and i never seen the error since

Read full topic

item.title: Fatal: Buffer overflow
item.dc:creator: @sic_pure sic pure
item.description:
@sic_pure wrote:

[quote=“Unid H4x0r, post:6, topic:136633”][quote author=-Legend- link=topic=188167.msg1698958#msg1698958 date=1188003740]

[quote author=Unid H4x0r link=topic=188167.msg1698947#msg1698947 date=1188003605]

Maybe it means too many people are in one area. Because in real Runescape people get like “stiff” when in world 1. And in my server it happens the same way near the mining area.
[/quote] na. happens all the time in RS servers
restart server…
or…
put it under public boolean proc

The more shit you have in process the more lag imo.
[/quote] what does imo and tbh mean lol[/quote]

tbh = to be honest, imo = how the fuck should I know???

I saw a server with over 255 people on and it didnt lagg but when the 256th person got on it crashed instantly.

Read full topic
